nodes.bodyText: Wrong log instance name, TestOzoneFileSystem -> TestOzoneDirectory
Will do it. Thanks!
Just a comment: will we introduced DIR_LOCK for dir table update in the future?
Yes, exactly. This is long term goal and will kick start once the primary changes are IN.

Minor:
Here this should be like this.ozoneAcls.add(ozoneacls)
Sure, will take care

Minor:
Here this should be like this.metadata.putAll(newMetadata)
Sure, will take care
Do we need to atleast print getObjectID() + name here?
Sure, will take care
Minor: New line missing at end of file.
Sure, will take care. One doubt, can't checkstyle detect this?
Minor: Newline missing at end of the file.
Sure, will take care
once we change setMetadata with the same code, we can remove this API.
Sure, will take care

Here still addallMetadata is there and setMetadata is removed.
I think that should be fine, but if we can name it as setMetadata it will be uniform with setAcls
Can we add a unit test similar to TestOMDirectoryCreateRequest.java
And also cover tests like FILE_EXISTS_IN_GIVEN_PATH, DIRECTORY_EXISTS, FILE_EXISTS and DIRECTORY_EXISTS_IN_GIVEN_PATH.
Good point, will add more UTs.
Minor: omPrefixInfo -> omDirectoryInfo
Sure, will take care
Minor: parentPrefixInfo -> parentDirectoryInfo
Sure, will take care
Good point, I will add logic to handle it.

result = OMDirectoryResult.DIRECTORY_EXISTS_IN_GIVENPATH;

Should this line of code be here, as here we found a directory exists in given path? But with this approach, I see there is no real use of it.

As 'OMDirectoryResult.DIRECTORY_EXISTS_IN_GIVENPATH' comment says, there are some part of the parent component exists.
Assume user given path is "vol1/buck1/a/b/c" in volume volume
If there is a directory with name "a/b" it returns this enum value.
Pls refer: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-ozone/blob/master/hadoop-ozone/ozone-manager/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/ozone/om/request/file/OMFileRequest.java#L202

DIRECTORY_EXISTS_IN_GIVENPATH is used when we check from leaf to parent, but now this logic is opposite.
I am fine with leaving, but not really required in this case.

I hope the variable name is confusing.
I think, rename variable 'parentInfo' to 'subDirInfo' , will make it more clear "subDirInfo.getParentObjectID(), subDirInfo.getName()".
Does it make sense to you?

nodes.bodyText:
Not understand what this TODO means here.
Can you explain what is missing here?

I just copy pasted from original file OMDirectoryCreateRequestV.java. I don't know more about this.
Please refer: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-ozone/blob/master/hadoop-ozone/ozone-manager/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/ozone/om/request/file/OMDirectoryCreateRequest.java#L270
We are creating entries for missing parent directories. I think we can remove this TODO.  But if you think there is something still missing, we can leave it.
Nothing specific. Will remove this comment.
Here should we increment Keys based on the number of directories being created?
Good catch. Yes, will incr it
Here we can add exisitingKeyPath also it will help in debugging failure scenario for like mkdir fails with FILE_EXISTS or FILE_EXISTS_IN_GIVEN_PATH or other error
'keyName' is already available as local variable and am making use of that. How about add it to 'OMPathInfoV1' later based on requirement ?

No my point here is lets say when user tries to create file '/a/b/c/file1" it failed with NOT_A_FILE, but I don't know from log error due to which part of the file exist. (As during some S3 debug, I thought this will be useful)
let me know your thoughts.
Thanks for the explanation. Yes, will add it.

We dont need this check.
As default inheritAcls is bucketAcls only.
Let's say, we create /a/b/c, now for all of them we have acls with bucketAcls.
So, next time when we create /a/b/c/d, then it will have Acls.
Sure, will remove it.

Now we don't really need this, as now logic checks from parent to leaf, as previous logic checks from leaf to parent DIRECTORY_EXISTS_IN_GIVENPATH makes sense, so we don't really need this special handling.
We need only full path in case of errors where we can return fullKeyPath.

As this is a utility function, I would like to return fullKeyPath this as well. Caller can take a decision to use it or not.
I will remove DIRECTORY_EXISTS_IN_GIVENPATH check here. But I would like to return result with DIRECTORY_EXISTS_IN_GIVENPATH just to make it readable. Hope thats fine!
Ya special handling if removed that is fine.

Cache KeyName also should be same as parentObjectID/dirname
As this is what we used to search for the entry in the directory table.

And also here entries are set with only leaf name, it should be full path.
Example:
/v/b/a/b1/c
Right now with this logic, missing directory Info's created in cache are which is wrong
/v/b/a
/v/b/b1 --> /v/b/a/b1
/v/b/c --> /v/b/a/b1/c
I see that we do in OMDirectoryCreateRequestV1.java, So we can remove adding to the cache here, which will solve this issue.
Right now because of the above logic we have both.
Good catch!
Can we have a new API in Metrics class to take a value for increment, instead of calling in for loop?
Sure, thats nice addition. Will do it
We can remove trace here in loop, we can log outside the for loop.

Here only validateAndUpdateCache is done, so it will only be in cache.
As Table get checks both in cache and DB first check should be enough here.
Sure, I will do dirNotExists check in testValidateAndUpdateCacheWithDirectoryAlreadyExists
Can we use Key separator(/) here?

Will this get confused with the value by getPath(). This will return "getParentObjectID() + OzoneConsts.OM_KEY_PREFIX + getName()"
I don't have strong opinion. If you feel then I can make toString() also like getObjectID() + OzoneConsts.OM_KEY_PREFIX + getName()
As discussed offline, we will print here  parentID/name:objectID
One more test can be added here file exists in a given path.
Sure, will add.
This can be removed, already volume/buckets use new id generation logic.

nodes.bodyText:
We are adding them 2 times once here, and next immediately in addDirectoryTableCacheEntries.
No correctness issue, but can be removed from one place.

Sure, I will remove it in my new class.
FYI, looks like existing code OMDirectoryCreateRequest.java#L276 has this issue. Like you said, there is no harm anyway and am not touching the current code.

Yes, looks like we can remove from existing code.
Let's open a new jira to fix this.

Minor:
keyName should be bucketKey+"/"+dirs.get(0)+"/"+dirs.get(1), as this is the key put in to keyTable.
No correctness issue BTW.

Thanks a lot for the detailed reviews.
With the new proposal, the key put into KeyTable will be in the new format 'parentID/fileName'. Secondly, the keyName attribute in OmKeyInfo object stores the name without vol/buck prefix part. It is like dirs.get(0)+"/"+dirs.get(1)+"/"+fileName.
Once HDDS-4266 changes are in, then it will be readable. Hope this is fine for you?
Yes. thanks for explanation.

For leaf, we have used baseObjID + objCount. But here it is mentioned we use baseObjID is used for leaf, assuming that it has started for missing directories from baseObjID +1.
 pathInfo.setLeafNodeObjectId(baseObjId + objectCount);
If we want to keep them sorted, we can start with ObjCount as 0. (Not sure, in future if this will help in the listing)
With this, there is a chance to exceed maxObjectID

Good point. I've used existing logic from code OMDirectoryCreateRequest#254.
I will add two more UTs to verify it. Also, I will remove the wrong comment. Hope this is fine?

testCreateDirectoryExceedLimitOfMaxLevels255
testCreateDirectoryUptoLimitOfMaxLevels255

Say,    baseObjId = 25600
        maxObjId  = 25855
        maxLevels = 25855 - 25600 = 255
Since the exit condition is "if (nextObjId > maxObjId)", it will exit and throw exception once
the value of nextObjId becomes 25856, which will be used for the leaf node.
